perfcenter.baseclass

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • perfcenter.baseclass.QueuingResource
      • perfcenter.baseclass.Device
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeviceSim

    public class Device
extends QueuingResource
    This class defines devices that would be deployed on Host. This class is agnostic to the actual type of device, and does not differentiate between CPU or disk or printer. Powermanagement feature of the device are built around those of CPU. This class holds the definition of a device instance, and its configuration parameters like its count, buffer size, scheduling policy, power up speed, etc.
    Author:
    akhila, rakesh, bhavin

    • Field Detail

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        Name of the device. This identifies the device throughout the perfcenter.

      • count

        public Variable count
        Number of device instances. This is used to spawn as many QServerInstance objects

      • buffer

        public Variable buffer
        Size of queue buffer. Its unit is number of requests.

      • schedulingPolicy

        public SchedulingPolicy schedulingPolicy
        Scheduling policy object which would decide how to enqueue and dequeue something.

      • speedUpFactor

        public Variable speedUpFactor
        Device speed up factor. It decides the effective service time of a job. e.g. speed up factor of "k" would require a job with service demand "s" to be served in the time "s/k".

      • holdingTime

        public double holdingTime
        Holding time of a job by the device. This is used by analytical perfcenter.

      • thinkTime

        public double thinkTime
        think time of a request at this device. This is used by analytical perfcenter.

      • numberOfUsers

        public double numberOfUsers
        Number of users at the device. This is used by analytical perfcenter.

      • availabelSpeedLevels

        public double[] availabelSpeedLevels
        Available operating speed leves for a power managed device.

      • powerConsumptionsLevels

        public double[] powerConsumptionsLevels
        The dynamic power consumption component corresponding to each speed level, of a power managed device.

      • idlePower

        public double[] idlePower
        Idle power consumption of the power managed device, for each speed level.

      • avgDeviceSpeedup

        public double avgDeviceSpeedup
        Saves average device speed. This is used only by the bottleneck function in the Output.

      • deviceProbeInterval

        public double deviceProbeInterval
        Device probe interval. Device is probed after this interval periodically.

      • upThreshold

        public double upThreshold
        The upthreshold parameter of the frequency scaling governor.

      • downThreshold

        public double downThreshold
        The downthreshold parameter of the frequency scaling governor.

      • governor

        public PowerManagementGovernor governor
        Governing policy of power-management governor.

      • isDevicePowerManaged

        public boolean isDevicePowerManaged
        Flag indicating whether this is a powermanaged device or not.

      • userspaceSpeedIndex

        public double userspaceSpeedIndex
        Used only by USERSPACE governor, gives the index of device speed selected for USERSPACE governor

      • totalFrequencyLevels

        public int totalFrequencyLevels
        Total frequency levels available for the device.

      • totalPowerLevels

        public int totalPowerLevels
        Total power levels available for the device.

      • totalIdlePowerLevels

        public int totalIdlePowerLevels
        Total idle power levels available for the device.

      • averageFrequency

        public Metric averageFrequency
        Average Frequency of the device.
